questions.question: What is the primary function of a Half Adder?
questions.explanation: A Half Adder is a combinational circuit that computes the sum using XOR and the carry using AND.

questions.question: Which operation does the sum output of a Full Adder perform?
questions.explanation: The sum output of a Full Adder is computed using XOR operations.

questions.question: What is the role of a Shifter in digital logic?
questions.explanation: A shifter moves bits left or right depending on the control signal.

questions.question: What logic gate is primarily used in a comparator circuit to compare two bits?
questions.explanation: A comparator uses an XOR gate to determine if two bits are equal or different.

questions.question: What is the function of a Decoder?
questions.option_a: Encodes multiple inputs into fewer outputs
questions.option_b: Converts binary information into a set of unique outputs
questions.explanation: A decoder takes n binary inputs and converts them into up to 2^n unique outputs.

questions.question: How many outputs does a 3-to-8 decoder have?
questions.explanation: A 3-to-8 decoder has 8 outputs since it decodes 3-bit inputs into one of 8 possible outputs.

questions.question: Which component is used to select one input from multiple inputs and route it to output?
questions.explanation: A multiplexer (MUX) selects one of several input signals and forwards it to the output.

questions.question: What does a Programmable Logic Array (PLA) consist of?
questions.explanation: A PLA consists of programmable arrays of AND and OR gates to implement Boolean functions.

questions.question: Which of the following is a function of an Arithmetic Logic Unit (ALU)?
questions.explanation: An ALU performs both arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction) and logical operations (AND, OR, XOR).

questions.question: How many AND gates are required to implement a 2-to-4 decoder?
questions.explanation: A 2-to-4 decoder requires 4 AND gates to produce four unique output combinations.
